title: iPhone 6 Front Panel Subjected to Scratch Test, Significant Bending  Mac Rumors
author: dummy
htmltext: Earlier today, we shared a video of what appeared to be the front panel of the 4.7-inch iPhone 6 subjected to a limited bending stress test, but YouTube user Marques Brownlee has now acquired the same front panel and subjected it to additional stress tests, including more significant bending and scratching.

sent.sent: Earlier today, we shared a video of what appeared to be the front panel of the 4.7-inch iPhone 6 subjected to a limited bending stress test, but YouTube user Marques Brownlee has now acquired the same front panel and subjected it to additional stress tests, including more significant bending and scratching

children.author: RosOne
children.htmltext: How exactly is this a "test"? Guy bends an iPhone and it bent. Wow :|

sent.sent: How exactly is this a quottestquot?
Guy bends an iPhone and it bent.

children.author: farewelwilliams
children.htmltext:
for the sake of Science?

more like for the sake of Youtube money.

sent.sent: for the sake of Science?more like for the sake of Youtube money.

children.author: Richardgm
children.htmltext: My 4S doesn't have that feature. Damn it Apple, keep leaving us in the dark!

sent.sent: Damn it Apple keep leaving us in the dark

children.author: Kebabselector
children.htmltext: Thin metal things bend - wow - and in other news bears continue to do business in woodland areas.

sent.sent: Thin metal things bend  wow  and in other news bears continue to do business in woodland areas.

children.author: Jmacman78
children.htmltext:
Gimme a break. you could do this with most phones on the market. Put pressure on it and it will bend/break no matter what it is.

Every time a new iPhone comes out everyone freaks out that it's a "bendgate".

sent.sent: you could do this with most phones on the market.
Put pressure on it and it will bendbreak no matter what it is.Every time a new iPhone comes out everyone freaks out that its a quotbendgatequot.
